Reference.Quotation: "There were a total 15 experiments: 12 experiments in which the injection involved the basal nucleus and three experiments in which the injection involved the accessory basal nucleus. The locations of each injection are summarized in Table 1 and schematically illustrated in coronal planes in Fig. 1. Within the basal nucleus, two injections involved mainly the dorsal division case M6-97/BDA, in which cells labelled an intercalated nucleus situated to caudal parts of the accessory basal nucleus and case M12-98/PHA-L, in which a few cells were located in the rostral intermediate division of the basal nucleus). Three injections were located in lateral parts of the intermediate division cases M5-97/PHA-L; M7-98/BDA and M-1198/BDA). In case M5-97/PHA-L, a significant amount of labelled neurons were located within the lateral. One injection case M11-97/PHA-L) involved medial parts of the intermediate division at the borders with the dorsal division. Two injections were located in the ventral medial division cases M2-98/BDA and M6-98/PHA-L). Four injections were located in the ventral lateral division cases M2-95/PHA-L, M4-97/BDA, M3-98/PHA-L, in which labelled cells were also located in the subjacent subiculum; and case M13-98/PHA-L). Data were not obtained from the periamygdaloid sulcal cortex. Within the accessory basal nucleus, three injections involved the three subdivisions of the nucleus: dorsal division case M4-98/BDA); ventral division case M14-97/BDA, in which the injection was located close to the borders of the intermediate division of the basal nucleus); and ventromedial division case M5-95/PHA-L)." (1973-1975)

"There were a total 15 experiments: 12 experiments in which the injection involved the basal nucleus and three experiments in which the injection involved the accessory basal nucleus. The locations of each injection are summarized in Table 1 and schematically illustrated in coronal planes in Fig. 1. Within the basal nucleus, two injections involved mainly the dorsal division case M6-97/BDA, in which cells labelled an intercalated nucleus situated to caudal parts of the accessory basal nucleus and case M12-98/PHA-L, in which a few cells were located in the rostral intermediate division of the basal nucleus). Three injections were located in lateral parts of the intermediate division cases M5-97/PHA-L; M7-98/BDA and M-1198/BDA). In case M5-97/PHA-L, a significant amount of labelled neurons were located within the lateral. One injection case M11-97/PHA-L) involved medial parts of th eintermediate division at the borders with the dorsal division. Two injections were located in the ventral medial division cases M2-98/BDA and M6-98/PHA-L). Four injections were located in the ventral lateral division cases M2-95/PHA-L, M4-97/BDA, M3-98/PHA-L, in which labelled cells were also located in the subjacent subiculum; and case M13-98/PHA-L). Data were not obtained from the periamygdaloid sulcal cortex. Within the accessory basal nucleus, three injections involved the three subdivisions of the nucleus: dorsal division case M4-98/BDA); ventral division case M14-97/BDA, in which the injection was located close to the borders of the intermediate division of the basal nucleus); and ventromedial division case M5-95/PHA-L)." (1973-1975)

"The projections from the basal nucleus to the hippocampus originated mainly in the ventral divisions and were directed to the subiculum. The ventral lateral and ventral medial divisions projected to different levels of the subiculum. All injections in the ventral lateral division gave rise to a moderate projection to the uncal portion of the subiculum. Injection in the ventral medial division case M2-98/PHA-L), and not the ventral lateral division, did not project to the uncal subiculum but the projection was sharply circumscribed to the body of the subiculum, at the immediate border of the CA1 a region also termed the prosubiculum; see Saunders et al., 1988). The projection was extended caudally to the septal end of the hippocampus." (p. 1989)

"All three injections sent heavy projections to the uncal portion of the subiculum Figs. 10C, 11D, and 13A and B). The labelled fibres were most dense rostrally, but they continued caudally in a position dorsal to the uncal portion of CA1. The dorsal division of the accessory basal nucleus was the only one of the regions investigated that give rise to a striking projection to the temporal two thirds of the CA1 field extending lightly to CA3 Fig. 13A and C). The labeling was heavy and primarily composed of short straight fibres resembling fibres en passage. Some of these fibres coursed through the amygdalohippocampal area to enter the hippocampus, but the evidence favours a direct projection from the dorsal division of the accessory basal nucleus to the CA1 field of the hippocampus." (p. 1989)

"There were a total 15 experiments: 12 experiments in which the injection involved the basal nucleus and three experiments in which the injection involved the accessory basal nucleus. The locations of each injection are summarized in Table 1 and schematically illustrated in coronal planes in Fig. 1. Within the basal nucleus, two injections involved mainly the dorsal division case M6-97/BDA, in which cells labelled an intercalated nucleus situated to caudal parts of the accessory basal nucleus and case M12-98/PHA-L, in which a few cells were located in the rostral intermediate division of the basal nucleus). Three injections were located in lateral parts of the intermediate division cases M5-97/PHA-L; M7-98/BDA and M-1198/BDA). In case M5-97/PHA-L, a significant amount of labelled neurons were located within the lateral. One injection case M11-97/PHA-L) involved medial parts of th eintermediate division at the borders with the dorsal division. Two injections were located in the ventral medial division cases M2-98/BDA and M6-98/PHA-L). Four injections were located in the ventral lateral division cases M2-95/PHA-L, M4-97/BDA, M3-98/PHA-L, in which labelled cells were also located in the subjacent subiculum; and case M13-98/PHA-L). Data were not obtained from the periamygdaloid sulcal cortex. Within the accessory basal nucleus, three injections involved the three subdivisions of the nucleus: dorsal division case M4-98/BDA); ventral division case M14-97/BDA, in which the injection was located close to the borders of the intermediate division of the basal nucleus); and ventromedial division case M5-95/PHA-L)." (1973-1975)

"The projections from the basal nucleus to the hippocampus originated mainly in the ventral divisions and were directed to the subiculum. The ventral lateral and ventral medial divisions projected to different levels of the subiculum. All injections in the ventral lateral division gave rise to a moderate projection to the uncal portion of the subiculum. Injection in the ventral medial division case M2-98/PHA-L), and not the ventral lateral division, did not project to the uncal subiculum but the projection was sharply circumscribed to the body of the subiculum, at the immediate border of the CA1 a region also termed the prosubiculum; see Saunders et al., 1988). The projection was extended caudally to the septal end of the hippocampus." (p. 1989)

"The projections from the basal nucleus to the hippocampus originated mainly in the ventral divisions and were directed to the subiculum. The ventral lateral and ventral medial divisions projected to different levels of the subiculum. All injections in the ventral lateral division gave rise to a moderate projection to the uncal portion of the subiculum. Injection in the ventral medial division case M2-98/PHA-L), and not the ventral lateral division, did not project to the uncal subiculum but the projection was sharply circumscribed to the body of the subiculum, at the immediate border of the CA1 a region also termed the prosubiculum; see Saunders et al., 1988). The projection was extended caudally to the septal end of the hippocampus." (p. 1989)

"All three injections sent heavy projections to the uncal portion of the subiculum Figs. 10C, 11D, and 13A and B). The labelled fibres were most dense rostrally, but they continued caudally in a position dorsal to the uncal portion of CA1. The dorsal division of the accessory basal nucleus was the only one of the regions investigated that give rise to a striking projection to the temporal two thirds of the CA1 field extending lightly to CA3 Fig. 13A and C). The labeling was heavy and primarily composed of short straight fibres resembling fibres en passage. Some of these fibres coursed through the amygdalohippocampal area to enter the hippocampus, but the evidence favours a direct projection from the dorsal division of the accessory basal nucleus to the CA1 field of the hippocampus." (p. 1989)
